title: Virgin Orbit ready for first U.K. launch
summary: Virgin Orbit is set to perform the first orbital launch from the United Kingdom as soon as Jan. 9, a milestone officials hailed as the start of a new era for the country’s space industry.

title: SpaceX gearing up for Falcon Heavy’s second national security launch
summary: SpaceX is aiming to launch Falcon Heavy’s second national security mission for the U.S. Space Force on Jan. 12 from Kennedy Space Center.

title: Defunct NASA satellite to reenter
summary: A defunct NASA satellite, launched nearly four decades ago, is predicted to reenter late Jan. 8 with a very small risk to people on the ground.

title: Launch preps underway for first of up to five Falcon Heavy missions this year
summary: SpaceX is set to kick off a busy week of launch preparations at Kennedy Space Center for the first of five planned Falcon Heavy rocket missions this year, targeting a dusk departure no earlier than Thursday evening from Launch Complex 39A on a flight for the U.S. Space Force.

title: Delta throws down the gauntlet with free Wi-Fi plan
summary: Plans by Delta Airlines to start offering free inflight Wi-Fi next month increases pressure on other major airlines to follow suit, driving up more demand for satellite capacity.
